intro: Pfitzeria, commonly known as the snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of only one species, Pfitzeria monticola, which is native to the high elevations of the western United States. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are evergreen, needle-like, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Pfitzeria thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil.
